page.title: 02THE BOLSOVER SCHOOL.
page.content: {The Bolsover School}is unique in that it is the only three-site comprehensive school in Derbyshire. It began in 1976 as a result of the amalgamation of three existing secondary modern schools,{Moorfield {Secondary Modern School, Bolsover {County Secondary Girls' School}and {Bolsover County Secondary Boys' {School.}Moorfield is now the {Upper Hall,}catering for the third to the sixth forms, while the Boys' and Girls' Schools are now{Lower Halls with four first and four second forms in each hall. The school has 75 teachers and about 1250 pupils, about 100 of whom are sixth formers. There are also sixteen welfare assistants. The Headmaster since 1976 has been Mr.B.R.Canning, formerly headmaster of Moorfield School.
